citations.narrative:
Two opossum enclosures have wire mesh dig barriers that are in need of repair. One enclosure has approximately 1/4 of
the wire dig barrier exposed along the ground and a hole in the wire approximately 5" x 4" in size. The second enclosure
has exposed dig wire along the back wall with gaps beneath it and a small area of dig wire that is beginning to detach
from the wood board along the bottom of the side wall. Exposed wire mesh can allow the animals to potentially get a toe
or nail caught and injure themselves. Additionally, a hole in the mesh barrier can allow predators or other pests to dig into
the enclosure, putting the animals at risk of injury or illness. Correct by 23 June 2025 by ensuring that all outdoor housing
facilities for the opossums are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to
contain the animals.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Two opossum enclosures have wire mesh dig barriers that are in need of repair. One enclosure has approximately 1/4 of 
the wire dig barrier exposed along the ground and a hole in the wire approximately 5" x 4" in size. The second enclosure 
has exposed dig wire along the back wall with gaps beneath it and a small area of dig wire that is beginning to detach 
from the wood board along the bottom of the side wall. Exposed wire mesh can allow the animals to potentially get a toe 
or nail caught and injure themselves. Additionally, a hole in the mesh barrier can allow predators or other pests to dig into 
the enclosure, putting the animals at risk of injury or illness. Correct by 23 June 2025 by ensuring that all outdoor housing 
facilities for the opossums are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to 
contain the animals. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
